Psychrometry

Deals with thermodynamic properties of moist air which helps to analyze and develop processes involving moist air.

Apps

Compute Properties 💻
Adiabatic mixing Cooling with dehumidification Evaporative cooling Heating with humidification

 

Background

Dry air exists when all water vapor and contaminants have been removed from atmospheric air. The composition of dry air is relatively constant, but small variations can occur with location and altitude. The relative molecular mass of dry air is 28.965 and the gas constant for dry air is: Ra=287.055 J/(kg.K).

Moist air is a mixture of dry air and water vapor. The amount of water vapor in moist air varies from zero (dry air) to a maximum (saturation) that depends on temperature and pressure. The molecular weight of water is 18.01528. The gas constant for water vapor is: Ra=461.520 J/(kg.K).
